bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, April 23, 1879

div1.p: Reed waits for Mrs. Compton in order to accompany her to an Army post. He misses his wife and son, and asks his wife to hire a nurse for their son.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, April 23, 1879
div1.opener:
ROBINSON HOUSE,
VANDIVER & SON, Proprietors.
Otero, N. M.,April 23rd 1879.
My darling wife:
div1.p:
I dropped you a postal from
Otero, yesterday afternoon, as I could only write
but a few words before the cars returned to
Trinidad. On my arrival, I found a letter
from Dr. Tremaine, Post Surgeon, at Fort Dodge,
Kansas, saying that Mrs. C. would leave
Washington April 21st (Monday instead of
Saturday.) and that he was very anxious that
she should stop over a few days at Fort
Dodge, if I could wait- I immediately wrote
him that I would remain at Otero till
Saturday 26th & no longer & that Mrs. Comp-
ton must not stop at Fort Dodge. I
think this will bring the lady by Saturday --
& on her arrival I will endeavor to leave same
day- I spend my time sitting around the store
& chatting with strangers- Of course, never a
moment passes without thinking of my
darling wife & boy- I would give a year's pay
just for one peep at you this morning.
By this time, you should be in St. Louis if not
beyond, & before I leave Otero, you will
be in Norfolk- Just think of it! I am per-
-fectly contented, however, knowing that you
my sweet wife, are once more back “inside,” with
your loved ones & that you can have
some chance for that enjoyment of which you
have been deprived so long. And then papa's
boy (“bad daddie”) can, at last, get a nurse,
I would give $10 to see him enfolded in
the arms of a stout, black negro gal.
How has he behaved himself on the way?
I know like a little man -- write & tell
me how you spent your time on the Cars
& everything you can think of- Love to
all -- will write again to-morrow-
A thousand kisses for “ditut, ditut day”,
& twice as many for yourself-
God bless & keep you, my precious E.
div1.closer:
Ever your devoted husband, Walter,
of Otero.
